cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterfly eggs in the egg stage are laid on the underside of leaves.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: usually laid there rather than elsewhere

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Metamorphosis takes place within the chrysalis.

qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: implied but not verbatim in this chunk

remarks: Spatial context partly inferred from entity descriptions rather than explicit preposition in this exact snippet.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a biological process, life stage, or event occurs in or at a specific physical location or part of an organism.
args.justification: Both relations describe where a biological stage/event happens: butterfly eggs (egg stage) being located on the underside of leaves, and metamorphosis occurring within the chrysalis. Despite minor surface-vs-interior wording differences, they share the same core spatial occurrence semantics, so a unified predicate 'occurs_in_location' is appropriate.

These relations connect biological processes or stages to the locations in which they take place. This is a family of spatial occurrence predicates, distinct from mere physical containment or part-whole relations.
The primary semantic dimension is spatial: specifying where something occurs (on the underside of leaves, within the chrysalis). This fits the broad SPATIALITY group.
